componentConfiguration.title: Accordion
componentConfiguration.paragraph: An accordion is a vertically stacked list of headers that reveal or hide related sections of content.

componentConfiguration.title: Action Sheet
componentConfiguration.paragraph: Action sheets are used as an overflow menu that appears in response to a control or action.

componentConfiguration.title: Alert
componentConfiguration.paragraph: Alerts are the most urgent 'notification' available in Kirby. They persist until users engage with them and only disappear when dismissed by the user.

componentConfiguration.title: Avatar
componentConfiguration.paragraph: Avatars are circular components that usually wrap an image, icon or text/initials. They can be used to represent a person or an object.

componentConfiguration.title: Badge
componentConfiguration.paragraph: Badges are inline block elements that appear on top of or close to another component. They often contain a number or an icon.

componentConfiguration.title: Button
componentConfiguration.paragraph: Buttons allow users to take actions, and make choices, with a single tap.

componentConfiguration.title: Calendar
componentConfiguration.paragraph: The Calendar is a picker interface that makes it easy for users to select dates.

componentConfiguration.title: Card
componentConfiguration.paragraph: Cards are containers that display content about a single subject or group a list of related information.

componentConfiguration.title: Chart
componentConfiguration.paragraph: Graphical representation for data visualization, in which the data is represented by symbols such as bars and lines.

componentConfiguration.title: Chart Stock
componentConfiguration.paragraph: The stock chart visualizes the price of a security over time where time is along the x-axis and the price is on the y-axis.

componentConfiguration.title: Checkbox
componentConfiguration.paragraph: A Checkbox is a control that permits the user to select options. Checkboxes are used for multiple choices, not for mutually exclusive choices.

componentConfiguration.title: Colors
componentConfiguration.paragraph: Set of Kirby Colors which lets you try out different color combinations.

componentConfiguration.title: Data table
componentConfiguration.paragraph: Data tables allow the user to show large amount of complex data in tabular form.

componentConfiguration.title: Divider
componentConfiguration.paragraph: The divider is a thin line which is used to visually separate elements or text.

componentConfiguration.title: Dropdown
componentConfiguration.paragraph: A dropdown is a compact way of displaying multiple choices from which a user can select one option.

componentConfiguration.title: Empty State
componentConfiguration.paragraph: Empty state occurs when an item og page can’t be shown.

componentConfiguration.title: FAB
componentConfiguration.paragraph: Floating Actions button is used for the most important action on a page. The FAB is placed in a fixed position (lower right corner of a page).

componentConfiguration.title: Flag
componentConfiguration.paragraph: A flag is a color code used to aid interpretation of or emphasize a piece of information (text and numbers).

componentConfiguration.title: Fonts
componentConfiguration.paragraph: Kirby font set which shows how to use the font through weight, hierarchy, size and color.

componentConfiguration.title: Form Field
componentConfiguration.paragraph: Form fields allows users to enter and edit information, such as 'text', 'email', 'numeric', 'number' and 'date'.

componentConfiguration.title: Icons
componentConfiguration.paragraph: The concept of the Kirby icon is to be rounded and friendly. They help to explain the action, function, etc.

componentConfiguration.title: Item
componentConfiguration.paragraph: Item is a placeholder that can contain text, icons, avatars, checkboxes, buttons etc. It’s a component that structures other components.

componentConfiguration.title: Page
componentConfiguration.paragraph: Page is a layout container for a Kirby application and provides a header & footer section. It is responsive and will change the layout according to the device size.

componentConfiguration.title: Progress Circle
componentConfiguration.paragraph: The Progress Circle is a circular visualization of the progression of an operation and activity.

componentConfiguration.title: Radio Buttons
componentConfiguration.paragraph: Radio button is a control that allows the user to select one option from a set while seeing all available options.

componentConfiguration.title: Range Slider
componentConfiguration.paragraph: The range slider makes it easy for users to select from a range of values by moving the slider knob.

componentConfiguration.title: Segmented Control
componentConfiguration.paragraph: A segmented control is a horizontal set of two or more segments, each of which functions as a button.

componentConfiguration.title: Slide Button
componentConfiguration.paragraph: The slide button is used to verify actions.

componentConfiguration.title: Slides
componentConfiguration.paragraph: Slides are a collection of cards you can navigate horizontally in, swipe on touch devices and click navigation on desktop.

componentConfiguration.title: Spinner
componentConfiguration.paragraph: A Spinner is a visual indicator for loading content or performing another process that the user needs to wait on

componentConfiguration.title: Toast
componentConfiguration.paragraph: Toasts are the most subtle 'notification' available in Kirby. These messages give users immediate feedback after taking an action.

componentConfiguration.title: Toggle
componentConfiguration.paragraph: A toggle changes the state of a single option between two mutally exclusive states - on and off.
